c74object.name: ossia.device
c74object.description: ossia.device creates a local device under which all models and parameters in the same patcher or below will register. Namespace of this device can then be exposed to local or distant applications through various protocols

outlet.name: Info outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

objarg.name: Name
objarg.description: ossia.device requires an argument defining the device name on the network

method.name: expose
method.digest: Expose the device to the network
method.description: Sending the expose message without any argument will print in Max Console various protocol and configuration options available Sending the expose message followed by a protocol name will explose the device to the network using the optional configuration option (ie. network ports)

method.name: name
method.digest: Set and get the global device's name
method.description: Sending the name message will output the current device's name out of ossia.device outlet Sending the name message followed by a symbol argument specifying new name will set the device's name

method.name: namespace
method.digest: Output list of all parameters and their current values
method.description: Sending the namespace message to the leftmost inlet outputs the list of all parameters registered under this node, and their current value

method.name: preset
method.description: Sending the preset save /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will write a list of all parameters and their values to the the disk, under the file /path/to/file.txt Sending the preset load /path/to/file.txt message to the leftmost inlet will load a list of all parameters and their values from the the file /path/to/file.txt, and recall the values to the parameters

method.name: set
method.description: Sending the set message followed by a node address and value will set the node to the value specified as argument

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to give a textual description for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: invisible
attribute.description: The invisible attribute allows to hide device on the network. Note that this attribute cannot be changed once the device has been exposed on the network

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The priority attribute allows to order how several values of a same hierarchical level can be recalled

attribute.name: recall_safe
attribute.digest: Enable or disable value update when recalling preset
attribute.description: The recall_safe attribute (default: off) allows to prevent value update when recalling a preset. This can be handy for example in live situation to prevent a model or parameter state to be recalled while being controlled by some processes (manual control, mapping, etc.)

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: trim_address
attribute.digest: Output absolute or relative address path
attribute.description: The trim_address attribute sets whether the address is output as a relative or absolute path
